abstract: Although Bear Stearns investors want to see the firm increase its international exposure, there is uncertainty as to whether the Citic deal will contribute to earnings.
snippet: Although Bear Stearns investors want to see the firm increase its international exposure, there is uncertainty as to whether the Citic deal will contribute to earnings.
lead_paragraph: When James E. Cayne, 73, the chief executive of Bear Stearns, flew to Beijing over the Labor Day weekend to discuss a partnership with Citic Securities, China’s largest investment bank, the two firm’s fortunes were diverging.

headline.main: Ailing Firm Gets Tonic From China
headline.print_headline: Ailing Firm Gets Tonic From China
